trans-unit.source: Displays a combo box in a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> control.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell> class is a specialized type of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell> used to display a combo box control, which is an editing field combined with a list selection field.

The currently selected <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell> hosts a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxEditingControl> in which the user can change the cell's value, assuming the cell's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.ReadOnly%2A> property is set to `false`.

Unlike the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox> control, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell> does not have <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox.SelectedIndex%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.SelectedValue%2A> properties.
Instead, selecting a value from a drop-down list sets the cell <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.Value%2A> property.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxColumn> is the column type specialized to hold cells of this type.
By default, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxColumn.CellTemplate%2A?displayProperty=fullName> is initialized to a new <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell>.

To pattern the cells within a column after an existing <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell>, set the column's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxColumn.CellTemplate%2A> property to the cell to use as a pattern.
The cell-related properties of the column are wrappers for the similarly-named properties of the template cell.
Changing the property values of the template cell will affect only cells based on the template that are added after the change.
Changing the cell-related property values of the column, however, will update the template cell and all other cells in the column, and refresh the column display if necessary.
You will typically work with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxColumn> type unless you want to override column values for specific cells.
The guidelines described in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxColumn> class overview topic for populating the drop-down list applies to both cell and column instances.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell"></xref> class.
This constructor initializes the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.AutoComplete%2A> property value to `true`.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the cell will match the characters being entered in the cell with a selection from the drop-down list.
`true` if automatic completion is activated; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `true`.
Creates an exact copy of this cell.

Override the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.Clone%2A> method whenever you derive from <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell> and add new properties to the derived class.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that represents the cloned <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell"></xref>.
Gets or sets the data source whose data contains the possible selections shown in the drop-down list.
Typically this property will be set for an entire column of cells through the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxColumn.DataSource%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
If possible, set <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DataSource%2A> to a source containing only the possible selections, like a column of selections.
Then the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DisplayMember%2A> property doesn't need to be set.
But if the source is more complicated, set <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DisplayMember%2A> to the name of the property or column from which to retrieve possible selections.

If <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DataSource%2A> is set to a string array, then <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.ValueMember%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DisplayMember%2A> do not need to be set because each string in the array will be used for both value and display.

Changing the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DataSource%2A> property causes the cell to reinitialize its <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.Items%2A> collection and redraw itself.

When you change the value of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DataSource%2A> property, the control attempts to use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.ValueMember%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DisplayMember%2A> property values with the new data source, and sets each property to `null` if its value cannot be found.

Any exception that occurs during this process is ignored unless it is one of the following critical exceptions: <xref:System.NullReferenceException>, <xref:System.StackOverflowException>, <xref:System.OutOfMemoryException>, <xref:System.Threading.ThreadAbortException>, <xref:System.ExecutionEngineException>, <xref:System.IndexOutOfRangeException>, or <xref:System.AccessViolationException>.

When the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DataSource%2A> is set, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell> attaches to the <xref:System.ComponentModel.Component.Disposed> event of the data source.
When the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell> is detached from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView>, the resource is not immediately released.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell> resource is released when the attached data source is disposed.
To release the resource for garbage collection immediately, set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DataSource%2A> property to `null`.
An <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref> or <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IListSource"></xref> that contains a collection of values used to supply data to the drop-down list.
The default value is `null`.
The specified value when setting this property is not `null` and is not of type <xref href="System.Collections.IList"></xref> nor <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IListSource"></xref>.
Removes the cell's editing control from the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref>.
Gets or sets a string that specifies where to gather selections to display in the drop-down list.
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DisplayMember%2A> represents the text information displayed in the combo box drop-down list.
In contrast, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.ValueMember%2A> property represents the corresponding value of a selection.

If the data for the selections displayed by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell> is supposed to be drawn from a nondefault property or column of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DataSource%2A>, then <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DisplayMember%2A> must be set in addition to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DataSource%2A>.

When <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DataSource%2A> is set to a string array, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DisplayMember%2A> does not need to be set because each string in the array will be used as a valid display string and a valid underlying value.
Another way of loading combo box selections is to use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.Items%2A> property.
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DisplayMember%2A> must contain the property name from which to gather the selections.
A string specifying the name of a property or column in the data source specified in the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DataSource"></xref> property.
The default value is <xref href="System.String.Empty"></xref>, which indicates that the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DisplayMember"></xref> property will not be used.

The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DataSource"></xref> property is not `null` and the specified value when setting this property is not `null` or <xref href="System.String.Empty"></xref> and does not name a valid property or column in the data source.
Gets or sets a value that determines how the combo box is displayed when it is not in edit mode.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DisplayStyle%2A> property affects the appearance of the cell when it is not in edit mode, and regardless of whether it is read-only.
When the cell is in edit mode, it always looks like a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox> control.

If the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DisplayStyleForCurrentCellOnly%2A> property value is `true`, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DisplayStyle%2A> property affects the cell only when it is the current cell.
The behavior and appearance of the drop-down arrow is indicated by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.FlatStyle%2A> property.

To enable cell highlighting when the mouse pointer is over the cell, you must set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DisplayStyle%2A> property to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxDisplayStyle.ComboBox> and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.FlatStyle%2A> property value to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FlatStyle.Popup>.

Setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxColumn.DisplayStyle%2A> property of the owning column also sets the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DisplayStyle%2A> property of every cell in the column and refreshes the column display.
To override the specified value for individual cells, set the cell values after you set the column value.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxDisplayStyle"></xref> values.
The default is <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxDisplayStyle.DropDownButton"></xref>.
The specified value when setting this property is not a valid <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxDisplayStyle"></xref> value.

Gets or sets a value indicating whether the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DisplayStyle"></xref> property value applies to the cell only when it is the current cell in the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> control.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DisplayStyle%2A> property affects the appearance of the cell when it is not in edit mode, and regardless of whether it is read-only.
When the cell is in edit mode, it always looks like a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox> control.
`true` if the display style applies to the cell only when it is the current cell; otherwise `false`.
The default is `false`.
Gets or sets the width of the of the drop-down list portion of a combo box.
This property corresponds to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox.DropDownWidth%2A> property of the hosted <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxEditingControl>.
The width, in pixels, of the drop-down list.
The default is 1.
The specified value is less than one.
Gets the type of the cell's hosted editing control.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxEditingControl> class is derived from the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox> class.
The <xref href="System.Type"></xref> of the underlying editing control.
This property always returns <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxEditingControl"></xref>.
Gets or sets the flat style appearance of the cell.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.FlatStyle%2A> property affects the behavior and appearance of the drop-down arrow in the cell.

To enable cell highlighting when the mouse pointer is over the cell, you must set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DisplayStyle%2A> property to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxDisplayStyle.ComboBox> and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.FlatStyle%2A> property value to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.FlatStyle.Popup>.

Setting the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxColumn.FlatStyle%2A> property of the owning column also sets the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.FlatStyle%2A> property of every cell in the column and refreshes the column display.
To override the specified value for individual cells, set the cell values after you set the column value.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.FlatStyle"></xref> values.
The default value is <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.FlatStyle.Standard"></xref>.
The specified value is not a valid <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.FlatStyle"></xref> value.
Gets the class type of the formatted value associated with the cell.
Because a combo box only handles text information, the type of the underlying formatted value is always <xref:System.String>.
The type of the cell's formatted value.
This property always returns <xref href="System.String"></xref>.
Returns the bounding rectangle that encloses the cell's content area, which is calculated using the specified <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> and cell style.
The graphics context for the cell.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle"></xref> to be applied to the cell.
The index of the cell's parent row.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that bounds the cell's contents.
Returns the bounding rectangle that encloses the cell's error icon, if one is displayed.
The graphics context for the cell.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle"></xref> to be applied to the cell.
The index of the cell's parent row.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that bounds the cell's error icon, if one is displayed; otherwise, <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle.Empty"></xref>.
Gets the formatted value of the cell's data.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> control calls this method to convert a cell value into an equivalent display value of the type indicated by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.FormattedValueType%2A> property.
The control passes the cell value to this method in the `value` parameter.
This method first determines whether `value` is valid by determining whether one of the following conditions is met.
`value` is present in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DataSource%2A> or the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.Items%2A> collection.
`value` is `null` or <xref:System.DBNull.Value?displayProperty=fullName>.
`value` is <xref:System.String.Empty?displayProperty=fullName> and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.ValueType%2A> property value represents the <xref:System.String> type.
If `value` is not valid, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.DataError?displayProperty=fullName> event occurs.

If there is no handler for this event or the handler sets the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewDataErrorEventArgs.ThrowException%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to `true`, an exception is thrown.

If `value` is valid or there is a handler for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.DataError> event and it does not set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewDataErrorEventArgs.ThrowException%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to `true`, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.CellFormatting?displayProperty=fullName> event occurs.
A <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.CellFormatting> event handler can modify both `value` and `cellStyle`.

If the handler does not set the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellFormattingEventArgs.FormattingApplied%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property to `true`, however, this method formats `value` using the formatting properties of the `cellStyle` object.
This can result in an additional <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.DataError> event.
If formatting is successful, this method returns the formatted value for display in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> control.
The value to be formatted.
The index of the cell's parent row.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle"></xref> in effect for the cell.

A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter"></xref> associated with the value type that provides custom conversion to the formatted value type, or `null` if no such custom conversion is needed.

A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter"></xref> associated with the formatted value type that provides custom conversion from the value type, or `null` if no such custom conversion is needed.
A bitwise combination of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewDataErrorContexts"></xref> values describing the context in which the formatted value is needed.
The value of the cell's data after formatting has been applied or `null` if the cell is not part of a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> control.

Formatting failed and either there is no handler for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.DataError"></xref> event of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> control or the handler set the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewDataErrorEventArgs.ThrowException"></xref> property to `true`.
The exception object can typically be cast to type for type conversion errors or to type if value cannot be found in the or the collection.
Calculates the preferred size, in pixels, of the cell.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> used to draw the cell.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle"></xref> that represents the style of the cell.
The zero-based row index of the cell.
The cell's maximum allowable size.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Size"></xref> that represents the preferred size, in pixels, of the cell.
Attaches and initializes the hosted editing control.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.InitializeEditingControl%2A> method initializes the hosted <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox> control as described in the base <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCell.InitializeEditingControl%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
In addition, for every invocation, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.InitializeEditingControl%2A> does the following:

Sets the visual properties of the hosted <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox> control, such as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox.MaxDropDownItems%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox.DropDownWidth%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox.FlatStyle%2A>, to match the corresponding properties of the current cell.

Sets the data-bound properties of the hosted <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox> control, such as <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox.DataSource%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.DisplayMember%2A>, and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ListControl.ValueMember%2A>, to match the corresponding properties of the current cell.
Reinitializes the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox.Items%2A> property of the hosted <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox> control.
This method also adjusts the cell's dimensions to accommodate the hosted <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox> control.
The index of the cell's parent row.
The initial value to be displayed in the control.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle"></xref> that determines the appearance of the hosted control.
Gets the objects that represent the selection displayed in the drop-down list.
This property enables you to obtain a reference to the list of items that are currently stored in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell>.
With this reference, you can add items, remove items, and obtain a count of the items in the collection.

For more information on the tasks that can be performed with the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.Items%2A> collection, see <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.ObjectCollection>.

If strings are added to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.Items%2A>, then <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.ValueMember%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DisplayMember%2A> do not need to be set because each string added will be used for both value and display.
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell> does not support the use of multiple items with identical display values.
If the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DataSource%2A> property is set, then the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.Items%2A> property cannot be used.

The formatted value of the cell must always be one of the values in the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.Items%2A> collection or an error will occur and the cell value will revert to the first item in the collection.

You can customize this behavior by handling the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.DataError?displayProperty=fullName> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.CellFormatting?displayProperty=fullName> events.

Setting this property to a value other than the value of the parent column's <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxColumn.Items%2A> property will force the row to become unshared, allocating extra memory.

For more information about row sharing, see [Best Practices for Scaling the Windows Forms DataGridView Control](~/docs/framework/winforms/controls/best-practices-for-scaling-the-windows-forms-datagridview-control.md).
An <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.ObjectCollection"></xref> containing the selection.
Determines if edit mode should be started based on the given key.

When the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.EditMode%2A> property of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> control is set to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewEditMode.EditOnKeystroke> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewEditMode.EditOnKeystrokeOrF2>, the control uses this method to determine whether a key other than F2 that is pressed by the user while this cell has focus will cause the cell to enter edit mode.

This method returns `true` if the e parameter indicates one of the following keys or key combinations: F4, ALT+UP ARROW, ALT+DOWN ARROW, or an ordinary data-entry key (such as a letter, number, punctuation mark, or the SPACE key) unmodified by ALT or CTRL, excluding SHIFT+SPACE, which is used by the control for selection purposes.

For more information, see [Default Keyboard and Mouse Handling in the Windows Forms DataGridView Control](~/docs/framework/winforms/controls/default-keyboard-and-mouse-handling-in-the-windows-forms-datagridview-control.md).
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.KeyEventArgs"></xref> that represents the key that was pressed.
`true` if edit mode should be started; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets the maximum number of items shown in the drop-down list.

Changing the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.MaxDropDownItems%2A> property changes the corresponding <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ComboBox.MaxDropDownItems%2A> property of the hosted <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxEditingControl>, if one exits.
The number of drop-down list items to allow.
The minimum is 1 and the maximum is 100; the default is 8.
The value is less than 1 or greater than 100 when setting this property.
Called when the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewElement.DataGridView"></xref> property of the cell changes.

The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DataSource"></xref> property is not `null` and the value of either the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DisplayMember"></xref> property or the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.ValueMember"></xref> property is not `null` or <xref href="System.String.Empty"></xref> and does not name a valid property or column in the data source.
Called when the focus moves to a cell.
The index of the cell's parent row.
`true` if a user action moved focus to the cell; `false` if a programmatic operation moved focus to the cell.
Called when the focus moves from a cell.
The index of the cell's parent row.
`true` if a user action moved focus from the cell; `false` if a programmatic operation moved focus from the cell.
Called when the user clicks a mouse button while the pointer is on a cell.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellMouseEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Called when the mouse pointer moves over a cell.
The index of the cell's parent row.
Called when the mouse pointer leaves the cell.
The index of the cell's parent row.
Called when the mouse pointer moves within a cell.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellMouseEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Paints the current <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell"></xref>.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> used to paint the cell.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that represents the area of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> that needs to be repainted.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that contains the bounds of the cell that is being painted.
The row index of the cell that is being painted.
A bitwise combination of <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewElementStates"></xref> values that specifies the state of the cell.
The data of the cell that is being painted.
The formatted data of the cell that is being painted.
An error message that is associated with the cell.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle"></xref> that contains formatting and style information about the cell.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewAdvancedBorderStyle"></xref> that contains border styles for the cell that is being painted.
A bitwise combination of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewPaintParts"></xref> values that specifies which parts of the cell need to be painted.
Converts a value formatted for display to an actual cell value.
The display value of the cell.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle"></xref> in effect for the cell.
A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter"></xref> for the display value type, or null to use the default converter.
A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter"></xref> for the cell value type, or null to use the default converter.
The cell value.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the items in the combo box are automatically sorted.
This property specifies whether the hosted <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxEditingControl> sorts existing entries and add new entries to the appropriate sorted position in the list.
When this property is set to `false`, new items are added to the end of the existing list.
The sorting operation is case-insensitive and performed in alphabetically ascending order.
`true` if the combo box is sorted; otherwise, `false`.
The default is `false`.
An attempt was made to sort a cell that is attached to a data source.
Returns a string that describes the current object.
A string that represents the current object.
Gets or sets a string that specifies where to gather the underlying values used in the drop-down list.
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.ValueMember%2A> represents the corresponding value of a selection.
In contrast, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DisplayMember%2A> property represents the text information displayed in the drop-down list.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DataSource%2A> property specifies the data source for the value of the selections displayed in the drop-down list.

If the data for the selections displayed by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell> is supposed to be drawn from a nondefault property or column of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DataSource%2A>, then <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.ValueMember%2A> must be set in addition to <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DataSource%2A>.

When <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DataSource%2A> is set to a string array, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.ValueMember%2A> does not need to be set because each string in the array will be used as a valid display string and a valid underlying value.
Another way of loading combo box selections is to use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.Items%2A> property.
<xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.ValueMember%2A> must contain the property name from which to gather the selections.
A string specifying the name of a property or column.
The default value is <xref href="System.String.Empty"></xref>, which indicates that this property is ignored.

The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewComboBoxCell.DataSource"></xref> property is not `null` and the specified value when setting this property is not `null` or <xref href="System.String.Empty"></xref> and does not name a valid property or column in the data source.
Gets or sets the data type of the values in the cell.
A <xref href="System.Type"></xref> representing the data type of the value in the cell.
